cells.data:
For Matt in a grunt process:
  1. Run JSDoc and export all the data to one JSON file (doc-data.json)
  2. Save doc-data.json as a js file (doc-data.js) in the docs folder
  3. contents of doc-data.js: var docData = {all the json}
  4. parse docData to find all the classes - something like this:
findObjectsInArray = function (targetArray, objProperty, value) {
    var i, totalItems = targetArray.length, newArr = [];
    for (i = 0; i < totalItems; i++) {
        if (targetArray[i][objProperty] === value) {
            newArr.push(targetArray[i].name.toLowerCase());
        }
    }
    return newArr;
};

classArray = findObjectsInArray(docData, "kind", "class");

  1. for each class, create an HTML file: classname.html
  2. I will give you the content for the HTML — it will be the same for all files
  3. I’ll handle the rest client-side

Notes:
https://www.npmjs.com/package/grunt-jsdoc
